page.title: 06Buildings' Survey
page.content: to the present day.In addition to post-war council housing at the southern end of the village there is a recent housing development designed to meet the needs of the elderly. The ground floors of some of the larger Victorian houses have been converted into shops.There was one purpose-built Edwardian shop in the Ridgebourne now sadly modernised called the Grosvenor Store.There is an excellent example of inter-war architecture in the Automobile Palace while the old 13Cth parish church on a hillock above the Lake is well worth a visit as is Old Hall Farm next door,a fine example of a traditional Welsh longhouse dating from the 16Cth.
